required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Extension of Protocol 002, Carbidopa-levodopa in Neovascular Extension of Protocol 002, Carbidopa-levodopa in Neovascular AMD

lead_sponsor.agency: Snyder, Robert W., M.D., Ph.D., P.C.

clinical_study.source: Snyder, Robert W., M.D., Ph.D., P.C.

brief_summary.textblock: This protocol is an extension of protocol 0002, Proof of Concept and Dose Ranging Study of carbidopa-levodopa in Neovascular AMD. that is a 3 month study of escalating doses of carbidopa-levodopa in neovascular AMD. This trial is a 9 month extension for patients who successfully complete protocol 0002 and wish to continue carbidopa-levodopa therapy. It will use the two higher dose regimens of protocol 0002. these will be assigned according to how well the higher dose was tolerated in protocol 0002.

detailed_description.textblock: This extension will employ the same medications, measurements, guidelines for anti-VEGF injections and safeguards as in protocol 0002. In combination with protocol 0002, it will provide a total of 12 months of therapy with carbidopa-levodopa.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients who complete 3 months of escalation dose carbidopa-levodopa, will receive 9 additional months of therapy with the highest dose used in protocol 0002, carbidopa-levodopa 25-100 mg 2 tablets TID. If that dose was not well tolerated in study 0002, the patient will receive the intermediate dose, carbidopa-levodopa 25-100 mg, 1 tablet TID.

primary_outcome.measure: Best Corrected Visual Acuity by ETDRS visual scale testing
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of the study (Visit 1) to the last completed visit, whether due to patient withdrawal, patient death or the completion of the last visit of the study (visit 10), a maximum of 9 months.
primary_outcome.description: Currently refracted, normal light, lines and letters read on the ETDRS chart

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of adverse events experienced by participants during the study
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events elicited by nonspecific questioning

secondary_outcome.measure: By OCT, central retinal thickness, in the eye with neovascular AMD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of the study (Visit 1) to the last completed visit, whether due to patient withdrawal, patient death or the completion of the last visit of the study (visit 10), a maximum of 9 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: By OCT, drusen volume in the eye without neovascular AMD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of the study (Visit 1) to the last completed visit, whether due to patient withdrawal, patient death or the completion of the last visit of the study, (visit 10), a maximum of 9 months.

intervention.description: High Dose: daily oral administration 2 tablets TID Intermediate Dose: daily oral administration 1 tablet TID

facility.name: Robert W Snyder, MD, PhD, PC
